org.nd4j.linalg.api.ops

Interface Op

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Accumulation, BroadcastOp, IndexAccumulation, LossFunction, ScalarOp, TransformOp
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Abs, ACos, AddOp, ASin, ASum, ATan, Axpy, BaseAccumulation, BaseBroadcastOp, BaseIndexAccumulation, BaseLossFunction, BaseOp, BaseScalarOp, BaseTransformOp, Bias, BroadcastAddOp, BroadcastCopyOp, BroadcastDivOp, BroadcastMulOp, BroadcastRDivOp, BroadcastRSubOp, BroadcastSubOp, Ceil, Col2Im, CompareAndReplace, CompareAndSet, CopyOp, Cos, CosineSimilarity, DivOp, Dot, DropOut, DropOutInverted, ELU, ELUDerivative, Eps, EqualsWithEps, EqualTo, EuclideanDistance, Exp, Floor, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, HardTanh, HardTanhDerivative, IAMax, Identity, Im2col, IMax, IMin, IsMax, LeakyReLU, LeakyReLUDerivative, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual, Log, LogSoftMax, ManhattanDistance, MatchCondition, Max, Max, MaxOut, Mean, Min, Min, MulOp, Negative, Norm1, Norm2, NormMax, NotEqualTo, OneMinus, Ones, Pow, Prod, RDivOp, RectifedLinear, ReplaceNans, Round, RSubOp, ScalarAdd, ScalarDivision, ScalarEquals, ScalarGreaterThan, ScalarGreaterThanOrEqual, ScalarLessThan, ScalarLessThanOrEqual, ScalarMax, ScalarMin, ScalarMultiplication, ScalarNotEquals, ScalarReverseDivision, ScalarReverseSubtraction, ScalarSet, ScalarSetValue, ScalarSubtraction, Set, SetRange, Sigmoid, SigmoidDerivative, Sign, Sin, SoftMax, SoftMaxDerivative, SoftPlus, SoftSign, SoftSignDerivative, Sqrt, Stabilize, StandardDeviation, Step, SubOp, Sum, TadCollapseAccumulation, Tanh, TanhDerivative, TestLossFunction, TimesOneMinus, Variance, VectorFFT, VectorIFFT

    public interface Op
    An op is defined as follows: name: name of the operation x: the origin ndarray y: the ndarray to parse in parallel z: the resulting buffer n: the number of elements to iterate over where x is the origin ndarray, y, is a pairwise op over n elements in the ndarray stored in result z

    This is followed from the standard template for a BLAS operation such that given a linear buffer, a function defines 3 buffers (x,y,z) and the associated strides and offsets (handled by the ndarrays in this case)
